item.title: a map is not the territory
item.description: A map is not the territory it represents, but, if correct, it has a similar structure to the territory, which accounts for its usefulness. — Alfred Korzybski, Science and Sanity, p. 58 why customer research is important in product-design -> you have to understand your audience and the context does first-principles-thinking work when it involves humanity? solution: munger-two-step references in media: marketing: the-medium-is-the-message art: the treachery of images allegory of the cave
